comments.body: @DanielRosenwasser why are you saying this is not correct?

This is in a generator body, and I'm not seeing _Yield_ getting turned off in this grammar: > # [14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions) Class Definitions > > ## Syntax > > _ClassDeclaration_[Yield, Default] : > >    `class` _BindingIdentifier_[?Yield] _ClassTail_[?Yield] > >    [+Default] `class` _ClassTail_[?Yield] > > _ClassExpression_[Yield] : > >    `class` _BindingIdentifier_[?Yield]opt _ClassTail_[?Yield] > > _ClassTail_[Yield] : > >    _ClassHeritage_[?Yield]opt `{` _ClassBody_[?Yield]opt `}` > > _ClassHeritage_[Yield] : > >    `extends` _LeftHandSideExpression_[?Yield]
We can always turn this into a separate issue.
Actually, I think this is fine because we're only expecting a _LeftHandSideExpression_ which doesn't seem to include yield expressions.

This is an example where a class expression is extending a parenthesized expression, not a yield expression.

Also, I would expect this to work.  The grammar states this:

ClassHeritage[Yield] :

   extends LeftHandSideExpression[?Yield]
So in this case we are supposed to pass along the ‘yield context’ when parsing the extends expression.

```
    -- Cyrus
```

From: Daniel Rosenwasser [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Tuesday, June 23, 2015 8:58 PM
To: Microsoft/TypeScript
Subject: Re: [TypeScript] Class expressions (#3568)

In tests/baselines/reference/generatorTypeCheck55.errors.txthttps://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/3568#discussion_r33115703:

> ```
>  function* g() {
> 
>      var x = class C extends (yield) {};
> ```
> -                      ~
> 
> -!!! error TS9003: 'class' expressions are not currently supported.
> -                                ~~~~~~~
> 
> +!!! error TS2507: Type 'any' is not a constructor function type.
> -                                 ~~~~~
> 
> +!!! error TS1163: A 'yield' expression is only allowed in a generator body.

Actually, I think this is fine because we're only expecting a LeftHandSideExpression which doesn't seem to include yield expressions.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/3568/files#r33115703.

@DanielRosenwasser @mhegazy @CyrusNajmabadi 
You're correct that this is allowed in Ecmascript, but we explicitly decided to disallow it in Typescript because it doesn't seem like a good thing to do.
And ditto for a class decorator like `@(yield)`, and computed properties of a class.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@!!! error TS2507: Type 'any' is not a constructor function type.
                                 ~~~~~
!!! error TS1163: A 'yield' expression is only allowed in a generator body.
    }
